lines.text: Today is the fifth day of November. Tomorrow is the sixth day of November, and the day after that is November seventh. And you know what day that is, don't you? November seventh is your 20th birthday.
Ain't that sweet of you to remember. Where's my birthday present?
Oh, you'll get your birthday present, providin' you haven't forgotten the agreement between us, which comes due on that day.
Oh, the agreement?
Yeah, the agreement, that you swore on a Bible to keep your side of... Have I ever laid hands on you since we've been married?
Yeah, as often as possible.
Sometimes, big shot, you don't seem to give me credit for very much intelligence at all. I've been to school in my life - and I'm a magazine reader!
I don't want to be in the same room with a man that would make me live in a house with no furniture! My daddy would turn over in his grave if he knew, he would just turn over in his grave.
If your daddy turned in his grave as often as you say he'd turn in his grave, that old man would plow up the graveyard.
He went off and left me without a Coke in the house!
Excuse me, Mr. Vacarro, but I wouldn't dream of eatin' a nut that a man had cracked in his mouth.
You've got many refinements.
Thank you.
Well, let's go in now. We got nothing to do but wait for tomorrow and see if we're remembered or forgotten.
So, the wedding was postponed?
Oh, no, not the wedding. We had the wedding. My daddy gave me away.
But you said Archie Lee waited.
Yeah, after the wedding he waited.
For what?
For me to be ready for marriage.
How long did he have to wait?
Oh, he's still waiting.
I find you different this evening in some way.
Never mind that.
Grown up suddenly.
I feel cool and rested for the first time in my life.

[Silva caresses her neck]
Don't touch me please, I don't like to be touched.
Then why do you smile?
Because you make me feel kind of hysterical Mr. Vacarro.

[knowing smile]
I do?

[starts to get up]
I think I'll go make us some lemonade.
[he holds her back]
What did you do that for?
I don't want to be deprived of the pleasure of your company. Not yet.
Mr. Vacarro you certainly are getting familiar.
Don't you have any fun loving spirit about you?
Yeah, but this isn't fun.
[laughs breathlessly and smiles]
Then why do you giggle?

[after being told to make him comfortable]
Ain't nobody comfortable in that house. Lucky if you can find a chair to sit down on. You want coffee?
No, just a nice cool drink of water.
Oh, well the house water runs warm. But if you've got the energy to run that old pump over there you can get yourself a nice cool drink from that there cistern.
I've got energy to burn.
I told him I'd be ready on my 20th birthday.
But that's tomorrow. And will you be ready?
Well, that all depends.
What on?
Whether or not the furniture comes back.
[he looks sideways at her]
I guess.
Mrs. Meighan your husband sweats more than any man I know and now I can understand why.
Small dogs have a loud bark.
No one is going to whistle at any woman of mine.
You take an awful lot for granted when you say mine. I came to you today for protection. What did I get? Slapped, sent home. Now, I'm telling you the agreement between us is over.
I feel so weak. Oh, my head is buzzy.
Fuzzy?
Hmm. Fuzzy and buzzy. My head is swingin' round. Must have been that swingin' that done it.
Is that what they call a Mona Lisa smile you got on your puss?
Come on up and sing me to sleep!
Excuse me, Mr. Vacarro, but I wouldn't dream of eatin' a nut that a man had cracked in his mouth.
You've got many refinements.
[repeated lines]
Baby Doll!
[repeated lines]

[to Archie]
Big shot!
